dmca.title: Violation of Copyright and Privacy
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern: Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim. Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal. Legal Response Team THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. -----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Posted At: Wednesday, July 26, 2006 6:57 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [TP-C271155V] Violation of Copyright and Privacy Subject: [TP-C271155V] Violation of Copyright and Privacy From: abuse@theplanet.com Subject: [TP-C271155V] Violation of Copyright and Privacy Reference: [TP-C271155V] For your review. Thank you, Policy Enforcement The Planet Internet Services, Inc. http://www.theplanet.com/legal/ ==== Original Message ==== 1. Violation of Copyright and Privacy Added by system at Wednesday, Jul 26 2006 10:28 am X-MailFrom: hapeegoh@yahoo.com X-RcptTo: abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com Received: from [172.16.214.181] by [10.5.0.64] (abacus) for ; Wed Jul 26 10:02:51 2006 Return-path: Delivery-date: Wed, 26 Jul 2006 10:02:51 -0500 Received: from smtp01.theplanet.com ([70.87.6.110]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from hapeegoh@yahoo.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1G5kuQ-000D64-Tu for abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com; Wed, 26 Jul 2006 10:02:50 -0500 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp01.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Wed, 26 Jul 2006 10:02:50 -0500 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from hapeegoh@yahoo.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1G5kuQ-0006g5-CX for abuse@theplanet.com; Wed, 26 Jul 2006 10:02:50 -0500 Received: from web51107.mail.yahoo.com ([206.190.38.149]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from hapeegoh@yahoo.com) with smtp (Exim) id 1G5kuQ-000D5J-38 for abuse@theplanet.com; Wed, 26 Jul 2006 10:02:50 -0500 Received: (qmail 40261 invoked by uid 60001); 26 Jul 2006 15:02:47 -0000 DomainKey-Signature: a=rsa-sha1; q=dns; c=nofws; s=s1024; d=yahoo.com; h=Message-ID:Received:Date:From:Subject:To:MIME-Version:Content-Type:Con tent-Transfer-Encoding; b=1+CvwXPUnFkaFboSstH1CiPRYgDWJZ1Q+6ZQN1W94FGMRwOSB8heCMSBQtdXDGHZV9kBED AuONqgoe5rW6nlmF5UXZwbriDgXbKa9VgPt+QPmPNPAvUdNtH1BnjXOUp56BsQI2uq03ceyr U03SpVAxH6XS2z6VcZ3ef780bBz8I= ; Message-ID: <20060726150247.40259.qmail@web51107.mail.yahoo.com> Received: from [68.202.70.197] by web51107.mail.yahoo.com via HTTP; Wed, 26 Jul 2006 08:02:47 PDT Date: Wed, 26 Jul 2006 08:02:47 -0700 (PDT) From: Hapeegoh Lucky Subject: Violation of Copyright and Privacy To: abuse@theplanet.com, staff@bikermatchmaking.com, hapeegoh@yahoo.com MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="0-1160342061-1153926167=:37732" Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit Received-SPF: none (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: 206.190.38.149 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of yahoo.com) client-ip=206.190.38.149; envelope-from=hapeegoh@yahoo.com; helo=web51107.mail.yahoo.com; X-OriginalArrivalTime: 26 Jul 2006 15:02:50.0601 (UTC) FILETIME=[90337D90:01C6B0C4] Received-SPF: none (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: 70.87.6.110 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of yahoo.com) client-ip=70.87.6.110; envelope-from=hapeegoh@yahoo.com; helo=smtp01.theplanet.com; (multipart/alternative) MIME element (text/plain) Please find the issue described below. I have been sent on a wild goose chase trying to find who "has jurisdiction" over the content on this site and so far have just been sent to three different dead ends. It is interesting to point out that the offender, staff@bikermatchmaking.com hasn't had the decency to even respond to my issue. > -------- Original Message -------- > Subject: Violation of Copyright and Privacy > From: Hapeegoh Lucky > Date: Mon, July 24, 2006 4:28 pm > To: CopyrightClaims@godaddy.com, staff@bikermatchmaking.com, > hapeegoh@yahoo.com > > I had published a story on the site dontdatehimgirl.com. I had registered as a member there and was given the power to edit/delete my post(s) as needed. The original copy of this post has since been removed from dontdatehimgirl.com at my specific request. > > You can imagine my suprise to find that http://www.bikermatchmaking.com has somehow managed to obtain this post (steal), copy and publish it on their own site without my permission! I do NOT want this post published and it must be removed immediately. > > The post can be found at: > http://www.bikermatchmaking.com/dont_date_him_girl_articles.htm > > The post is listed under the heading: > > * DatingSite: IM > * Handle: vigentleman007 > > I find it very disturbing that this site has stolen this content for their own use. There are definite glaring privacy and likely copyright issues surrounding this poor business practice. If this post is not removed immediately I will seek out legal action, as well as inform the gentleman the post is about. He too will surely seek legal action due to this gross misuse and abuse by website. > > I am requesting that MY WORDS are removed from this site as they HAD NO PERMISSION TO PUBLISH THEM. > > Please contact me directly to follow up on this: home-386-682-3370 or cell-386-986-9371 > > www.bikermatchmaking.com's use of this information is completely inappropriate and unacceptable. Their site has the credibility of a Dr. Seuss, they don't even allow any way for you to contact an actual person. No phone numbers, nothing, just a measly email address that I still have yet to get a reply from. > > Not happy. --------------------------------- Want to be your own boss? Learn how on Yahoo! Small Business. MIME element (text/html) 
Please find the issue described below. I have been sent on
a wild goose 
chase trying to find who "has jurisdiction" over the
content
on this site and so far have just been sent to three
different dead ends.

It is interesting to point out that the
offender, staff@bikermatchmaking.com
hasn't had the decency to even
respond to my issue.

> -------- Original Message
--------
> Subject: Violation of Copyright and Privacy
>
From: Hapeegoh Lucky <hap
eegoh@yahoo.com>
> Date: Mon, July 24, 2006 4:28 pm
>
To: CopyrightClaims@godaddy.com, staff@bikermatchmaking.com,
> hap
eegoh@yahoo.com
> 
> I had published a story on the site
dontdatehimgirl.com. I had 
registered as a member there and was
given the power to edit/delete my 
post(s) as needed. The original
copy of this post has since been removed from 
dontdatehimgirl.com at
my specific request.
> 
> You can imagine my suprise to find
that 
http://www.bikermatchmaking.com has somehow managed
to obtain this post 
(steal), copy and publish it on their own site
without my permission! I 
do NOT want this post published and it must
be removed 
 immediately.
> 
> The post can be found at:
> http://www.bikermatchmaking.com/dont_date_him_girl_artic
les.htm
> 
> The post is listed under the
heading:
> 
>     * DatingSite: IM
>     * Handle:
vigentleman007
> 
> I find it very disturbing that this site
has stolen this content for 
their own use. There are definite
glaring privacy and likely copyright 
issues surrounding this poor
business practice. If this post is not 
removed immediately I will
seek out legal action, as well as inform the 
gentleman the post is
about. He too will surely seek legal action due to 
this gross misuse
and abuse by website.
> 
> I am requesting that MY WORDS are
removed from this site as they HAD 
NO PERMISSION TO PUBLISH
THEM.
> 
> Please contact me directly to follow up on this:
home-386-682-3370 
 or 
cell-386-986-9371
> 
> www.bikermatchmaking.com's
use of this information is completely 
inappropriate and
unacceptable. Their site has the credibility of a Dr. 
Seuss, they
don't even allow any way for you to contact an actual person. 
No
phone numbers, nothing, just a measly email address that I still

have yet to get a reply from.
> 
> Not
happy.

Want to be your own boss? Learn how on Yahoo! Small Business. MIME element (text/plain)
